page.title: 13Wildlife in Woodlands
page.content: There is lots of wildlife in our area, like rabbits,foxes,deer, otters,frogs and toads,salmon and many birds. Rabbits make their homes on open areas or at the edges of woods. They also like sandy areas because it is easier for them to make their burrows.Foxes live in dens in the forests and hunt open areas.They hunt things like rabbits,hens from farms and young deer.Farmers and gamekeepers shoot them and trap them.Salmon live in the fresh,clean waters of the River Dee. Fishermen fish for them.The salmon go up river every year. They jump very high out of the water.Roe deer live in forests and graze in open areas.They destroy trees by rubbing their antlers on the bark. There are lots of game birds like pheasants and partridges in the area. The pheasants are shot for sport.
